lines.text: You'll never find peace by hating, lad. It only shuts ye off more from the world. And this town is only a cursed place, if ye make it so. To the rest of us, 'tis a blessed place!

Two hundred years ago, the highlands of Scotland were plagued with witches, wicked sorcerers that were taking the Scottish people away from the teachings of God and putting the Devil into their souls. They were indeed horrible destructive women. I dinna suppose you have such women in your country?
Witches?
Oh we have 'em. We pronounce it differently.
What happened in Brigadoon was a miracle, and most folks dinna believe in miracles. Miracles require faith, and faith seems to be as dead as...
Mr. Forsythe?

[glances at him]
Aye.
Frank, put it on the bill.
The bill, sir, is very high.
So am I!
[In a crowded bar]
It's hot in here.
It's not the heat, it's the humanity.
I'm highly attracted to you. Why, when I look at you I feel wee tadpoles jumping in my spine.
That's about as repulsive an idea as I've heard in years!
Can you think of one good reason why I, a strange man, should be interested in proposing to you, a mighty strange woman and at this hour of the day?
Because you're a lad and I'm a lass!
Well, with that philosophy you must have had a provocative career!

[miserable]
Why do people have to lose things to find out what they *really* mean?
...There's nothing a woman hates more than her fiancee's best friend. He knows all the secrets she's going to spend the rest of her life trying to find out.
It's the hardest thing in the world to give everything. Though it's usually the only way to get everything.
You're confused, aren't you boy? If you believed as much as you *thought* you believed, you *wouldn't* be confused.
[Tommy is concerned about Jeff's drinking]
You told me you were going to ease up.
Yeah I know, but I'm a terrible *liar*.

[last lines; Tommy's love has re-awakened Brigadoon]
Tommy lad, you! My, my! You must really love her. You woke me up.
[He gestures to Tommy]
Come, lad.
[Tommy slowly crosses the bridge to Mr. Lundie, then looks about him, confused]
You shouldna be too surprised. I told ye... if you love someone deeply enough, anything is possible.
[Tommy stares down the road towards Brigadoon]
Even... *miracles*?
Well, most of my friends who have inferiority complexes are absolutely right. They're *not* as good as everybody else!
If they want to disregard two hundred years of human bing-bang, that's their privilege.
If there's *anything* I hate... it's *you*!
And may God bless me this evening as much as I would bless Him if I were He and He were Charles Dalrymple.

[referring to Fiona]
She's a dear lass.
I'm just beginning to find that out.

[He's being restrained after attacking Jean at the wedding]
All that I've done was to want ye too much.
I'm leaving Brigadoon! 'Tis the end of all of us! The miracle is over!
[He rushes away]
Let me ask you something... suppose someone in Brigadoon got fed up and wanted to leave? What then?
Och, he canna leave!
You mean *I've* got to stay here now?
Look... I'm not saying I believe all this, but just for argument's sake... suppose... suppose a stranger like... well, like... like me... came to Brigadoon and wanted to stay. Could he?

[gives him a long look, then smiles]
Aye, he could. Mr. Forsythe provided for that.
He didn't miss a trick, did he?

[laughing]
No, lad, he didna! No, a stranger could stay if he loved someone here... not Brigadoon itself, mind, but someone *in* Brigadoon... enough to be willing to give up everything to stay near that person... which is only right because after all, lad... if you love someone deeply enough, anything is possible.
